SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.topcoder.db.connectionfactory
Class DBConnectionFactoryImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.db.connectionfactory.DBConnectionFactoryImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBConnectionFactory
public class DBConnectionFactoryImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBConnectionFactory

A default implementation of DBConnectionFactory interface.

This class implements a simple mapping from the names to ConnectionProducers which are used to create the connections to the databases. Any of registered producers can be set to be used to create the connections by default.

This class provides the constructors allowing to instantiate and initialize the factory instance either programmatically or from the parameters specified by the configuration file. A non-argument constructor may be used to create the empty factory which may be populated at runtime through appropriate mutator methods. The constructor accepting a single String argument may be used to instantiate and initialize the factory from the parameters provided by a specified configuration namespace.

Main Changes in version 1.1:
(1) Two extra methods declared in DBConnectionFactory interface to allow clients obtaining connections that are authenticated with user-provided credentials rather than credentials recorded in component configuration are implemented in this class.
(2) All the NullPointerException thrown are replaced by IllegalArgumentException in this version.
(3) Two extra constructors are added in this version to support creating the factory based on the configuration described with a ConfigurationObject. The original constructor reading configuration from config-manager is deprecated.

Sample Configuration: 

   <Config name="com.topcoder.db.connectionfactory.DBConnectionFactoryImpl">
       <Property name="connections">
           <Property name="default">
               <Value>MySqlJDBCConnection</Value>
           </Property>
           <Property name="MySqlJDBCConnection">
               <Property name="producer">
                   <Value>com.topcoder.db.connectionfactory.producers.JDBCConnectionProducer</Value>
               </Property>
               <Property name="parameters">
                  <!---Here is the configuration for creating ConnectionProducer-->
               </Property>
            </Property>
        </Property>
      </Property>
   </Config>

Note: The Property and the ConfigurationObject used to initialize this class have the similar formats (see sample above). But the configuration from ConfigurationObject exists in the "parameters" child of the root configuration object.

Side Note : Empty String means the length of string after trimming equals to zero.

Thread Safety: this class is thread-safe. To maintain the thread safety the methods affecting the state of the factory, like #add(String, com.topcoder.db.connectionfactory.producers.ConnectionProducer), clear(), remove(String), setDefault(String) are declared with 'synchronized' access. The thread safety is implemented at instance level rather than at instance field's level since, most likely, the mutator methods will be called at the construction and initialization time. They are not expected to be called intensively during the lifetime of a factory instance. Note that if the users use the iterator returned by listConnectionProducerNames to traverse the names and they still want the thread safety when traversing, they must perform synchronized(this factory) during the whole traverse.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1
Author:
isv, qiucx0161, nhzp339, magicpig

Field Detail

DEFAULT_NAMESPACE

public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_NAMESPACE

The default namespace to read the configuration from the ConfigurationObject passed into the constructors. It's immutable and will be used by the new constructor DBConnectionFactoryImpl(com.topcoder.configuration.ConfigurationObject).

Since:
1.1
Constructor Detail

DBConnectionFactoryImpl

public DBConnectionFactoryImpl()

Constructs new DBConnectionFactoryImpl. Such a new DBConnectionFactoryImpl will have no ConnectionProducers registered and the default connection is non-determined.

This constructor can be used to instantiate the factory to be populated programmatically.

DBConnectionFactoryImpl

public DBConnectionFactoryImpl(java.lang.String namespace)
                        throws ConfigurationException,
                               UnknownConnectionException
Deprecated.  

Constructs new DBConnectionFactoryImpl initialized with the configuration parameters provided by specified configuration namespace. The factory is populated with the ConnectionProducers constructed from the configuration parameters provided by specified configuration namespace and mapped to corresponding names.

This constructor may be used to instantiate the factory initialized from the parameters provided by specified configuration namespace.

Parameters:
namespace - a String specifying the configuration namespace to be used to initialize this factory.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified argument is null or an empty string.
ConfigurationException - if any error occurs while reading the configuration properties and initializing the state of the factory, including if specified namespace is not loaded to a Configuration Manager.
UnknownConnectionException - if the producers provided don't contain the default producer specified.

DBConnectionFactoryImpl

public DBConnectionFactoryImpl(com.topcoder.configuration.ConfigurationObject configurationObject)
                        throws ConfigurationException,
                               UnknownConnectionException

Creates new DBConnectionFactoryImpl based on the configuration specified in a ConfigurationObject instance from the default namespace. The ConfigurationObject instance will have the format consistent with Configuration Persistence component.

Parameters:
configurationObject - The root configuration object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the configurationObject parameter is null.
UnknownConnectionException - if the producers provided don't contain the default producer specified
ConfigurationException - if any error occurs while reading the configuration and initializing the state of the factory or the configuration is malformed.
Since:
1.1

DBConnectionFactoryImpl

                               java.lang.String namespace)
                        throws ConfigurationException,
                               UnknownConnectionException

Creates new DBConnectionFactoryImpl based on the configuration specified in a ConfigurationObject instance from the specified namespace. The ConfigurationObject instance will have the format consistent with Configuration Persistence component.

Parameters:
configurationObject - the root configuration object.
namespace - The namespace storing the info for this factory
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the any parameter is null or the namespace is an empty string.
UnknownConnectionException - if the producers provided don't contain the default producer specified
ConfigurationException - if any error occurs while reading the configuration and initializing the state of the factory or the configuration is malformed.

Method Detail

createConnection

public java.sql.Connection createConnection()
                                     throws NoDefaultConnectionException,
                                            DBConnectionException

Creates the connection to a database using the ConnectionProducer set as default. The operation may fail if a default producer is not specified.

Specified by:
createConnection in interface DBConnectionFactory
Returns:
a Connection providing the connection to a database. Will not be null.
Throws:
DBConnectionException - if any error occurs while creating a connection.
NoDefaultConnectionException - if the default connection producer is not configured within this factory.

createConnection

public java.sql.Connection createConnection(java.lang.String name)
                                     throws UnknownConnectionException,
                                            DBConnectionException

Creates the connection to a database using the ConnectionProducer registered under specified name within this factory. The operation may fail if there is no ConnectionProducer mapped to specified name.

Specified by:
createConnection in interface DBConnectionFactory
Parameters:
name - the specified name of ConnectionProducer
Returns:
a Connection providing the connection to a database. Will not be null.
Throws:
DBConnectionException - if any error occurs while creating a connection.
UnknownConnectionException - if there is no ConnectionProducer registered under specified name within this factory.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified argument is null or an empty string.

createConnection

public java.sql.Connection createConnection(java.lang.String username,
                                            java.lang.String password)
                                     throws NoDefaultConnectionException,
                                            DBConnectionException

Creates a connection to a database authenticated with the specified username and password using the default producer.

Specified by:
createConnection in interface DBConnectionFactory
Parameters:
username - The username with which to connect to the database. Can be any String instance including null and empty string.
password - The user's password. Can be any String instance including null and empty string.
Returns:
a Connection providing the connection to a database. Will not be null.
Throws:
DBConnectionException - if any error occurs while creating the connection.
NoDefaultConnectionException - if the default connection is not configured within this factory
Since:
1.1

createConnection

public java.sql.Connection createConnection(java.lang.String name,
                                            java.lang.String username,
                                            java.lang.String password)
                                     throws UnknownConnectionException,
                                            DBConnectionException

Creates a connection to a database authenticated with the specified username and password from a producer with the specified name.

Specified by:
createConnection in interface DBConnectionFactory
Parameters:
name - the name of the connection configured within this factory. Can't be null or empty string.
username - The username with which to connect to the database. Can be any String instance including null and empty string.
password - The user's password. Can be any String instance including null and empty string.
Returns:
a Connection providing the connection to a database. Will not be null.
Throws:
DBConnectionException - if any error occurs while creating the connection.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the name parameter is null or an empty string.
UnknownConnectionException - if a connection with specified name is not configured within this factory.
Since:
1.1

add

public boolean add(java.lang.String name,
                   ConnectionProducer producer)

Registers the specified ConnectionProducer under the specified name within this factory. Nothing happens if specified name is already mapped to another ConnectionProducer.

Parameters:
name - a String specifying the name to map the specified ConnectionProducer to.
producer - a ConnectionProducer to be registered within this factory.
Returns:
true if there is no other ConnectionProducer mapped to specified name already; false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null, or the specified 'name' is an empty string.

remove

public ConnectionProducer remove(java.lang.String name)

Removes a ConnectionProducer registered under specified name from this factory. If specified producer is currently set to be used by default then the default producer becomes non-determined.

Parameters:
name - a String specifying the name of registered ConnectionProducer to remove from this factory.
Returns:
a ConnectionProducer corresponding to specified name or null if such a producer is not registered.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified argument is null or an empty string.

contains

public boolean contains(java.lang.String name)

Checks if this this factory contains a ConnectionProducer registered under specified name or not.

Parameters:
name - a String providing the name of configured ConnectionProducer to check for.
Returns:
true if this factory contains a ConnectionProducer mapped to specified name; false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified argument is null or an empty string.

getDefault

public java.lang.String getDefault()

Gets the name of the ConnectionProducer registered within this factory which is used by default.

Returns:
a String providing the name of default ConnectionProducer registered within this factory or null if such a default ConnectionProducer is not specified.

setDefault

public void setDefault(java.lang.String name)
                throws UnknownConnectionException

Sets the name of the ConnectionProducer registered within this factory to be used by default. There should be a ConnectionProducer registered under specified name within this factory. The null argument value indicates that no ConnectionProducer should be used by default.

Parameters:
name - a String providing the name of default ConnectionProducer registered within
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified 'name' is an empty string
UnknownConnectionException - if specified name does not correspond to any ConnectionProducer registered to this factory.

listConnectionProducerNames

public java.util.Iterator listConnectionProducerNames()

Gets the iterator over the names of ConnectionProducers registered within this factory. The returned iterator is a fail-fast iterator.

Note that if the users use the iterator returned by this method to traverse the names and they still want the thread safety when traversing, they must perform synchronized(this factory) during the whole traverse.

Returns:
an Iterator over the names of ConnectionProducers registered within this factory. Will never be null.

get

public ConnectionProducer get(java.lang.String name)

Gets the ConnectionProducer registered within this factory under specified name.

Parameters:
name - a String providing the name of ConnectionProducer to get.
Returns:
a ConnectionProducer matching the specified name or null if such a producer is not registered within this factory
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified argument is null or an empty string.

clear

public void clear()

Removes all ConnectionProducers registered within this factory. The producer to be used by default becomes non-determined.
